Package gameenv

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameenv.GameEnvironment
  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the game environment and passes controls the flow of objects to and from the required classes in order to create the game windows and functionality for the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameEnvironment()
      Creates a GameEnvironment instance, and creates a Ship object and initial Planet object for the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void gameOver​(java.lang.String gameOverText)
      Game over method, called when the game is over if different conditions are met.
      void gameWon()
      Game won method, called when the game ends with winning conditions satisfied.
      void goToNewPlanet()
      Advances the game by a day and creates a new planet.
      void goToNextDay​(boolean flyingToNewPlanet)
      Advances the game by a day, which resets crew actions and increments their health, tiredness, and hunger levels based on the associated degradation values.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method for the GameEnvironment class.
      void mainMenu()
      Initializes the title screen window and the start button, which continues to the setup screen.
      void newDay()
      Holds the ActionListener instances for the main game window buttons, and calls the necessary methods when a button is clicked.
      void newGame()
      Launches the game and creates the game GUI.
      void repairShip()
      Passes the currently selected crew member to the repairShip method and creates necessary dialogs when the crew member repairs the ship.
      void searchPlanet()
      Passes the currently selected crew member to the searchPlanet method and creates dialogs for any found items.
      void setupScreen()
      Creates the crew selection window, which displays the attributes for different crew member classes.
      void viewShipState()
      Creates a new ShipStatusView object and holds the ActionListener for the 'Leave' button that re-enables the main view window.
      void visitShop()
      Actions when a player enters the shop with a crew member.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEnvironment

        public GameEnvironment()
        Creates a GameEnvironment instance, and creates a Ship object and initial Planet object for the game.

    • Method Detail

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        Launches the game and creates the game GUI.

      • mainMenu

        public void mainMenu()
        Initializes the title screen window and the start button, which continues to the setup screen.

      • setupScreen

        public void setupScreen()
        Creates the crew selection window, which displays the attributes for different crew member classes. Also allows the naming of the crew members. Once selected, the main game view method is called.

      • visitShop

        public void visitShop()
        Actions when a player enters the shop with a crew member. Also Generates the items that will be available for purchase in the shop.

      • newDay

        public void newDay()
        Holds the ActionListener instances for the main game window buttons, and calls the necessary methods when a button is clicked.

      • viewShipState

        public void viewShipState()
        Creates a new ShipStatusView object and holds the ActionListener for the 'Leave' button that re-enables the main view window.

      • repairShip

        public void repairShip()
        Passes the currently selected crew member to the repairShip method and creates necessary dialogs when the crew member repairs the ship.

      • searchPlanet

        public void searchPlanet()
        Passes the currently selected crew member to the searchPlanet method and creates dialogs for any found items. Any items found will be added to the associated inventory.

      • goToNextDay

        public void goToNextDay​(boolean flyingToNewPlanet)
        Advances the game by a day, which resets crew actions and increments their health, tiredness, and hunger levels based on the associated degradation values. Can trigger certain random events.
        Parameters:
        flyingToNewPlanet - takes a boolean value for whether the crew are flying to a new planet. If true, it enables the extra Asteroid Field event.

      • goToNewPlanet

        public void goToNewPlanet()
        Advances the game by a day and creates a new planet. May trigger a random event.

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver​(java.lang.String gameOverText)
        Game over method, called when the game is over if different conditions are met.
        Parameters:
        gameOverText - takes a String which shows the reason for the game over.

      • gameWon

        public void gameWon()
        Game won method, called when the game ends with winning conditions satisfied.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for the GameEnvironment class. Starts the game.
        Parameters:
        args -
